title: Stop Your PC from Forward Deleting Text as You Type

steps.title: Press Insert or Ins once.
steps.content: Press Insert or Ins once. The key is usually near the top-right corner of the keyboard. Pressing this key toggles the Insert function on or off in any app on your PC, including Notepad and Excel. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source If the Ins key is shared with an "F" key, such as F12, hold down the Fn key as you press Ins . If your Ins key is on the numeric keypad, press the Num Lock , NumLk , or similar key to activate it first.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+Z to restore accidentally deleted text.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + Z to restore accidentally deleted text. You may have to press this key combination to undo all of the text you've accidentally replaced. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type your text again.
steps.content: Type your text again. Now that you've pressed the key, you should be able to type without replacing what's already on the page. If you're using Microsoft Word and find yourself accidentally pressing the ‚å§ Ins key too often, you might want to disable overtype mode. See the Disabling Overtype Mode in Microsoft Word method to learn how. If you're still having trouble entering new text, save your work and close the application. When you restart the app, you should be able to type text normally.

steps.title: Click the File menu.
steps.content: Click the File menu. It's at the top-left corner of Word. [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Options.
steps.content: Click Options . It's toward the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Remove the checkmark from "Use the Insert key to control overtype mode."
steps.content: Remove the checkmark from "Use the Insert key to control overtype mode." It's under the "Editing Options" header.

steps.title: Remove the checkmark from "Use overtype mode."
steps.content: Remove the checkmark from "Use overtype mode." It's right below the last box you unchecked.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . Pressing the Ins key in Microsoft Word will no longer toggle on/off overtype mode.
